segments.text: could we possibly discuss my salary some time ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: first of all , I want you to know that I really like working for this company . Do you think I'm doing a good job here ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: well , you are a very hard-worker .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I try very hard . The problem is , my salary just isn't enough to live on . Now that I have a wife and a child to support , we hardly have enough money for food and rent .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: there are trying times for everyone . What do you propose ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I could really use a 5 % rise .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that's quite a bit . If I give you a raise , I'm going to have to give everyone a raise .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: listen , if you give me a raise , I'll take on extra responsibilities .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: that sounds reasonable . How about this , from now on , you can be responsible for scheduling . That means that if you can't find someone to cover a shift , then you'll have to do it .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that's fine . Do I get over-time for any extra hours that I work ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: of course . It's be against the law if we didn't .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: that sounds good to me . I really appreciate it .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: you are welcome . Come in early tomorrow and I'll show you how to do the scheduling .
segments.speaker: S2
